message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the application of machine learning techniques and reasoning processes to improve the performance of context-based recommender systems. This involves addressing issues such as reducing cold start problems, adapting to user interests, and speeding up the learning process. The paper proposes a hybrid Q-learning algorithm that combines Q-learning, collaborative filtering, and case-based reasoning techniques. This work involves aspects of artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
